description_txt: stated on November 19, 2013 in a new book:
quote_txt: "We are experiencing the worst economic recovery America has ever had."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2013 in its website:
quote_txt: "Defensive medicine costs Georgia up to $14 billion a year."

description_txt: stated on December 6, 2013 in a broadcast of CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: "The CBO just said if we cut this (unemployment benefits) extension, we will kill jobs, because those people who are looking for work won't have any money to spend."

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2013 in a video:
quote_txt: "(U.S. Rep. Jack Kingston) voted to fund (Obamacare)."

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2013 in a broadcast of the "Daily Show":
quote_txt: "The most popular name is no longer John or Steven. It's Jose, Camilo and Maria."

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2013 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "FACT: Repealing Obamacare would be easier than repealing Prohibition."

description_txt: stated on November 27, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: Even after collective bargaining reforms, most Wisconsin public employees "are still paying about 12 to 13 percent" of their health insurance premiums, while most state residents who work in the private sector "pay 20 to 25 percent."

description_txt: stated on December 8, 2013 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "One-third of all bank tellers (are) on public assistance."

description_txt: stated on December 8, 2013 in an interview on ABC’s "This Week":
quote_txt: "About 2 percent of Americans get paid the minimum wage."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2013 in a blog post on his campaign website:
quote_txt: "I have cut taxes 63 times, including a 2006 property tax reduction that ranks as the largest in state history."

description_txt: stated on November 14, 2013 in an interview on the John Gambling radio program:
quote_txt: "We pay among the highest tolls in the nation for the privilege of crossing that bridge."

description_txt: stated on November 27, 2013 in an email:
quote_txt: "The Walton family, which owns Wal-Mart, controls a fortune equal to the wealth of the bottom 42 percent of Americans combined."

description_txt: stated on December 3, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: Passing a federal firearms "background check through the NICS database . . . typically takes 90 seconds."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • December 8, 2013

description_txt: stated on December 13, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: "At present spending levels, only citizens of New York have a greater local debt burden than Texans."

description_txt: stated on November 25, 2013 in an Internet ad campaign:

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2013 in an email to a constituent:
quote_txt: Obamacare medical device tax "has led to the loss of thousands of jobs" in U.S.

description_txt: stated on December 4, 2013 in a broadcast of MSNBC's Politics Nation:
quote_txt: The "priorities" of more than three-quarters of Americans are to increase the minimum wage, create a path to citizenship for illegal immigrants, and require background checks for gun buyers.

description_txt: stated on December 4, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: "By the time she turns 3 years old, a child born into a low-income home hears 30 million fewer words than a child from a well-off family."

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2013 in a meme on the Internet:
quote_txt: Says Vladimir Putin said, "President Obama and his fellow Democrats are either idiots or deliberately trying to destroy their own economy."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2013 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: It's a good sign for Obamacare that in California, "the proportion of kids who are signing up is the proportion of kids in the population."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2013 in a broadcast of "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: Obamacare is a "massive, massive income redistribution" with "$250 billion a year in Medicaid expansion (and) in the subsidy structure that's basically being paid for by people on Medicare, through Medicare cuts, and a lot of tax increases."

description_txt: stated on November 27, 2013 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Why would our president close the embassy to the Vatican? Hopefully, it is not retribution for Catholic organizations opposing Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on December 4, 2013 in a speech at the Center for American Progress:
quote_txt: The minimum wage "in real terms right now is below where it was when Harry Truman was in office."

description_txt: stated on December 4, 2013 in a meme on social media:
quote_txt: "44% of homeless people are employed."

description_txt: stated on November 25, 2013 in a mailed flier:

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2013 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
